TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit UserNamePasswordClientCredential extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a client credential based on user name and password.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class enables the user to configure the user name and password for a WCF<xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> credential when using user name/password authentication. If the channel factory's binding is not configured to use user name/password-based authentication, the user name and password are not used. If the channel factory's binding is configured to use federated security that requires getting an issued token from a security token service, the user name and password are also presented to the security token service if it requires user name/password authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Password { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

remarks.format:
## Remarks To get or set this property, access the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordClientCredential> object from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> property from the client object, as shown in the code below.
[!code-csharp[S_UEUserNamePasswordClientCredential#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueusernamepasswordclientcredential/cs/source.cs#10)] [!code-vb[S_UEUserNamePasswordClientCredential#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueusernamepasswordclientcredential/vb/source.vb#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ UserName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the user name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For user name/password authentication, this property is required and cannot be `null` or empty.
## Examples To get or set this property, access the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordClientCredential> object from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> property from the client object, as shown in the code below.
[!code-csharp[S_UEUserNamePasswordClientCredential#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueusernamepasswordclientcredential/cs/source.cs#10)] [!code-vb[S_UEUserNamePasswordClientCredential#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueusernamepasswordclientcredential/vb/source.vb#10)]
